Description: Rim sherd of North Ionian (Aeolian?) black-figured pottery bowl with traces of handle root; interior glazed; at top, between added white bands, frieze of tall alternate glaze and red tongues, lined in white; red and white bands below; exterior: large handle palmette; to its right rear of bull to right with incised tail and red patch on haunch, amid amorphous filling ornament; below, band with added red band lined in white; slightest traces of decoration in frieze below.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1025)
